business.headline: Sensex, Nifty early gains to close lower amid global headwinds; HUL gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 217.41 points to close at 74,115.17, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 92.20 points to end at 22,460.30.

Large caps vs midcaps vs small caps: Where should you invest now?Markets witnessed a brief respite after closing their best week in 2025 last week. Broader markets, especially midcap and smallcap stocks, performed well. The BSE Midcap index gained 3%, while the BSE Smallcap index jumped 6% last week.
Need funds? Here's how to get a loan against mutual fundYou can apply online or visit the lender's branch by submitting a loan application form and providing details of your mutual fund holdings.

7th Pay Commission: DA hike announcement this week, likely before HoliOver 12 million central government employees and retirees are likely to benefit from the said hike under the 7th Pay Commission. With this possible revision, the DA would increase from 53% to 55% of the basic pay.

Defence boost from Europe? These 4 PSU stocks could see strong upsideAccording to ICICI Securities, defence companies that already have supply agreements, partnerships, or orders from European firms are likely to benefit the most. The brokerage firm has highlighted four companies that could gain from this.

Retail inflation likely fell below 4% in February: ReportAs fresh winter produce hit markets over the past few months, food items - which make up nearly half of the inflation basket - saw a sustained slowdown in price increases.

Is your startup looking for funding? Top 4 opportunities in IndiaOne of the biggest funding programmes available right now is the Startup Maha Rathi Challenge, which is part of Startup Mahakumbh 2025.

SRK wins tax dispute case: What is foreign tax credit and how to claim it? Khan had declared an income of Rs 83.42 crore in his tax return, but the tax officer reassessed it as Rs 84.17 crore and denied him foreign tax credit (FTC) for taxes paid in the UK.

IndusInd Bank share price hits 52-week low. Check target price and what's next?IndusInd Bank stock price: The sell-off came after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) approved only a one-year extension for CEO Sumant Kathpalia, despite the board recommending a three-year term.

Stock market bounces back, but will the relief rally last?Overall, the situation on Dalal Street looks much better than how it appeared at the beginning of last week. Does this mean investors can take it easy now?

EPFO announces new rules for EDLI Scheme: 3 key death benefits updatesThe EDLI scheme is part of the Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) and acts as a social security benefit, offering financial assistance to the dependents of an EPF member in the event of the untimely death of the EPF member while still employed.
Why are Tata Power shares rising today? Details here Tata Power stock has had a mixed run. The stock is down 20% in the past six months but has still gained 67% over the past two years.

entertainment.headline: Badshah's weight-loss video stuns fans, internet thinks he looks like AP DhillonA recent video of Badshah has left fans stunned by his physical transformation. While promoting his new clothing brand, he showcased his new look, prompting fans to compare him to fellow Punjabi singer and rapper AP Dhillon.

When Life Gives You Tangerines review:  IU, Park Bo-gum's series is a must-watchReleased-Fri Mar 07, 2025In When Life Gives You Tangerines, IU and Park Bo-gum deliver mesmerising performances in a story that spans decades. Set against the backdrop of 1960s Jeju, this K-drama explores themes of love, endurance, and the quiet strength of women.

Actor Helly Shah on TV's future: We need to up our gameActor Helly Shah talks about her comedy debut, TV's regressive content, and her Bollywood aspirations. She also shares that she dreams of playing bold and tough roles.

Lollapalooza Day 2: Louis Tomlinson, Aurora, Green Day make thunderous India debutMumbai's Mahalaxmi Racecourse became the epicentre of music as Lollapalooza India 2025 wrapped up Day 2. From Green Day's electrifying debut to indie rock and soulful serenades, it was a night of musical magic.

Suits LA: Harvey Spector lands on the West Coast, throws some sass at Ted BlackIn the new promo of 'Suits LA', Harvey Spector is finally seen interacting with Ted Black. Actor Gabriel Macht will be joining the show for a three-episode arc.

Exclusive: How Shawn Mendes collaborated with Indian sitarist for Lolla India setSinger Shawn Mendes collaborated with sitarist Megha Rawoot for Day 1 for Lollapalooza India. In an exclusive interview with Megha Rawoot, she spoke about her performance.

Security sought for Rashmika Mandanna after MLA's 'teach her a lesson' remarkAn association seeking rights for natives of Karnataka's Coorg (Kodagu) region, Codava National Council, urged the state authorities to provide security for actor Rashmika Mandanna. According to the council, the actor was being unfairly targeted after Congress MLA Ravi Ganiga claimed she refused to attend a Kannada film industry event.

Shankar Mahadevan remembers 'guiding light' Zakir Hussain on birth anniversaryIt was legendary tabla maestro Zakir Hussain's 74th birth anniversary on Sunday. Marking the occasion, singer and composer Shankar Mahadevan honoured him with heartfelt birthday wishes on social media.

Lady Gaga recalls psychosis diagnosis and how she felt 'ashamed' to talk about itIn an interview, singer Lady Gaga discussed her personal struggles that kept her away from music. She shared insights into her mental health journey, being diagnosed with psychosis and the support from her partner, Michael Polansky.

The Last of Us 2 trailer: Pedro Pascal and Bella Ramsey promise thrilling returnThe first full trailer of The Last of Us Season 2 is here. Starring Pedro Pascal and Bella Ramsey in lead roles, the HBO Max series promises a bigger and better season.

Lollapalooza India Day 1: Shawn Mendes must return for a solo concert in IndiaThe first day of Lollapalooza India 2025 kicked off on a grand note with Canadian singer Shawn Mendes' electrifying performance. The show also witnessed performances by several Indian artists, like Jonita Gandhi and Divine among others.

Shawn Mendes honours Virat Kohli, wears Team India jersey at Mumbai show. WatchSinger Shawn Mendes impressed fans with his debut India performance on March 8 at the Lollapalooza Mumbai show. During the concert, the singer delighted fans by wearing Virat Kohli's Team India jersey.

general news.headline: Didn't hit, but verbally abused me: Ranya Rao alleges harassment in DRI custodyKannada actor Ranya Rao, during her hearing, accused the DRI officials of verbally abusing her during interrogation. Rao was sent to DRI custody for three days by a Special Court, with the stipulation she be produced in court again on March 10.
Designers apologise for Gulmarg show: Deeply regret hurt caused during RamzanDeeply regret any hurt caused: Designers apologise after uproar over Gulmarg fashion show during Ramzan

Devendra Fadnavis backs calls for Aurangzeb's tomb removal with jab at CongressThis comes a week after Samajwadi Party's Abu Azmi sparked controversy by praising Mughal emperor Aurangzeb. He claimed that Aurangzeb had built temples and was not a cruel emperor.

Why Pakistan representatives were missing from Champions Trophy closing ceremonyThe reason why there were no Pakistan representatives at the Champions Trophy closing ceremony has been revealed as an ICC spokesperson spoke to India Today about the situation. The absence of PCB officials at the closing ceremony created a lot of backlash, with Shoaib Akhtar being one of the people voicing his displeasure.
Why are women more prone to weight issues?Throughout different life stages, puberty, pregnancy, and menopause, hormonal fluctuations can lead to increased fat accumulation.

Why Nepal is seeing a churn for Hindu monarchyThousands of people welcomed former king Gyanendra to Kathmandu amid a rise in calls to reinstate Hindu monarchy in Nepal. The Himalayan kingdom is seeing bike rallies and surge in online posts seeking a return to monarchy. This is what is fuelling these calls in Nepal, which was the last Hindu kingdom till 2008, when it became a secular republic.

Caught on CCTV: Customers held at gunpoint, Rs 25 lakh robbery at Tanishq showroomA group of men carried out a daylight robbery at a Tanishq showroom in Bihar's Ara, holding the customers and staff at gunpoint and stealing jewellery worth Rs 25 lakh. Two robbers were later injured in a police encounter.

Thaw in India-Canada ties soon? What Trudeau's successor Mark Carney saidMark Carney, a former Goldman Sachs executive, was on Sunday named Justin Trudeau's successor as the Prime Minister of Canada and leader of the ruling Liberal Party. Trudeau resigned in January, months after facing a stiff internal revolt with demands for him to step down.

Cricket victory rally turns violent in Mhow: Clashes, arson, arrests rock townCommunal violence erupted in Madhya Pradesh's Mhow after stones were thrown at a cricket victory rally, leading to arson and multiple arrests. Authorities imposed strict measures, warning against misinformation as investigations continue.

Why Health Ministry has ordered IPL to ban surrogate tobacco, alcohol adsThe Health Ministry has written to IPL Chairperson ahead of the upcoming season to ban surrogate tobacco and alcohol advertisements due to the growing burden of non-communicable diseases in the country.

11 of 12 toilets clogged, Chicago-Delhi Air India flight turns back mid-airThe airline, however, said that the flight made a U-turn after being airborne for more than five hours due to a technical issue.

Vanuatu moves to cancel fugitive Lalit Modi's passport: Bid to avoid extraditionVanuatu Prime Minister Jotham Napat accused the fugitive businessman and ex-IPL chief Lalit Modi of using the island nation's citizenship to evade extradition.

IIFA Awards 2025: Laapataa Ladies, Kill and Kartik Aaryan bag top honoursDirector Kiran Rao's Laapataa Ladies, Kill, Kartik Aaryan and several others won big at the IIFA 2025. The award ceremony took place in Jaipur on March 9.

7th Pay Commission: DA hike announcement this week, likely before HoliOver 12 million central government employees and retirees are likely to benefit from the said hike under the 7th Pay Commission. With this possible revision, the DA would increase from 53% to 55% of the basic pay.

Rohit Sharma's X-rated message to critics: Virat Kohli and I are not retiringRohit Sharma had some choice words for his critics as he announced that he and Virat Kohli won't be retiring from ODIs just yet after India's Champions Trophy win on Sunday, March 9. India defeated New Zealand in Dubai to win their third Champions Trophy title.

Heathrow Airport passengers face delays after car catches fire in tunnelTwo fire engines were dispatched to the scene to extinguish the flames, but the car was entirely destroyed, forcing National Highways to close the M4 southbound, between Junctions 4 and 4A.

Video: High-school student attacked with baton by opponent during relay raceKaelen Tucker, representing Brookville High School, was competing in the second leg of the relay at the Liberty University campus in Lynchburg when the incident occurred.

Weather may dampen Holi celebrations in Delhi as rain predicted on March 14Unseasonal rain and strong winds are set to disrupt Holi celebrations in parts of North India, with the weather department forecasting showers in Delhi, Punjab, and Haryana, while Gujarat braces for a pre-Holi heatwave.

Meet Trudeau's successor Mark Carney, who once likened Trump to VoldemortOn Sunday, Mark Carney was elected as Justin Trudeau's successor after Liberal Party members voted in a nominating contest. Trudeau resigned in January, months after facing a stiff internal revolt with demands for him to step down.

Kerala teen follows online weight-loss plans, dies after extreme dietingAn 18-year-old girl from Kerala's Kannur district died due to health complications linked to extreme dieting. She reportedly followed online weight-loss plans and had a deep fear of gaining weight.

Blood moon on Holi: Will India witness Total Lunar Eclipse?The phenomenon is caused by the Earth's atmosphere scattering shorter wavelengths of light, allowing only red and orange wavelengths to reach the Moon's surface.

Air India's New York flight returns to Mumbai after threat note found in toiletAn Air India flight from Mumbai to New York was forced to return mid-air after a potential security threat was detected onboard. Security agencies are inspecting the aircraft, and passengers have been accommodated until the rescheduled departure.

Learn art of overcoming obstacles: Gautam Gambhir stuns Sidhu with poemThe usually serious Gautam Gambhir decided to stun Navjot Singh Sidhu with a few lines from a poem after India's Champions Trophy win on Sunday, March 9. India defeated New Zealand to win the final.

Rahul Gandhi raises voter roll issue in Lok Sabha, DMK walks out of Rajya Sabha Live UpdatesThe government and Opposition engaged in a heated clash as Parliament's Budget session resumed today, with key battles over electoral roll irregularities, National Education Policy (NEP), Manipur violence, the Waqf Bill and delimitation.

Priyanka Chopra arrives in Odisha for Mahesh Babu's SSMB 29 shootActor Priyanka Chopra is back in India to resume filming for SS Rajamouli and Mahesh Babu's SSMB 29. She was seen posing for pictures with the cabin crew at Bhubaneswar airport.

Surreal and magical: Singer Lisa Mishra on sharing stage with Ed SheeranSinger Lisa Mishra performed the opening act for British singer Ed Sheeran during his concert in India earlier this year. Speaking exclusively to India Today Digital, the 31-year-old reflected on her experience of the same. Additionally, she opened up about working with Ananya Panday in Call Me Bae.

Hell is here: Kajol's Maa motion poster promises chilling supernatural thrillerKajol's mythological horror drama Maa gets a chilling motion poster. Directed by Vishal Furia, the film releases in Hindi, Bengali, Tamil, and Telugu on June 27, promising intense drama and suspense.

sports.headline: If India played in Pakistan, they would still have won Champions Trophy: Wasim AkramLegendary pacer Wasim Akram feels that the current Indian team would have won the Champions Trophy even if they played all their matches in Pakistan. India claimed their third Champions Trophy title with a win over New Zealand in Dubai on March 9.

Watch: Shubman Gill dances with father after India's victory Champions Trophy: Shubman Gill celebrated India's win against New Zealand with his father, Lakhwinder Singh. Gill scored 31 runs in the final as India won by four wickets.

If challenges are tough, throw some punches: Hardik PandyaChampions Trophy 2025: Hardik Pandya scored 18 runs at a run-a-ball on Sunday as India won the title after beating New Zealand by four wickets at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Ban tobacco, alcohol ads: Director general of health services tells IPL chairmanThe Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has written to the IPL chairman and the BCCI asking for a strict ban on tobacco and alcohol advertising during the upcoming season of the IPL, which will begin on March 22.

The pacer missed the summit clash due to an injury and was left in tears ahead of the game on Sunday.

Champions Trophy victory proves why Gambhir is right man for white-ball jobGautam Gambhir secured his first ICC title as the India head coach on Sunday, March 9. After his title win, Gambhir stayed away from the limelight, making sure that he did not take the focus away from the players who had played near flawless cricket to secure the trophy.

IND vs NZ: Rohit Sharma's approach puts fear in bowlers, says Mitchell SantnerNew Zealand captain Mitchell Santner praised Rohit Sharma for his performance in the final of the Champions Trophy 2025. Rohit's 76 set up the thrilling chase for India on Sunday, March 9 in Dubai against the Blackcaps.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
